results.title: DoDo and the Touchies
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 52 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo helps the inhabitants on the planet Laugh/Cry who are under threat of invasion by inhabitants of another planet known as the Touchies. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: DoDo and the space pirates
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 30 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo is called in to avert trouble from a UFO which he manages to achieve in a non-violent fashion. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: DoDo and the smellometer
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Joy Batchelor, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 60 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode DoDo captures the thieves of a valuable painting by means of a unique “smellometer”. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: Dodo's arrival story
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 41 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode the whole gang have a party to celebrate DoDo’s first anniversary on Earth, but, when DoDo is asked to recall how he came to Earth, his account provokes a conflict of memories. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: Dodging with Chuck O'Connell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lacrosse - the Fastest Game on Two Feet”.
An instructional film for student players, demonstrating the technique of dodging in lacrosse. With coach Chuck O’Donnell.

results.title: Dodging the column
results.brief_description: The transporting of a distillation column, 137 feet long, 500 miles by road from Greenwich to Grangemouth in Scotland. The commentary, spoken by the rigger in charge and one of the tractor drivers, expresses the humour and resourcefulness with which these transport workers tackle their job. The camera has captured moments of beauty as well as some amusing episodes in this journey of the longest load to travel by road in England.
results.description: The transporting of a distillation column, 137 feet long, 500 miles by road from Greenwich to Grangemouth in Scotland. results.title: Dodge your debts
results.brief_description: A fast paced slapstick farce starring Gaylord Lloyd (Harold Lloyd’s brother). Set in England, involves a debt collector, scores of bobbys, a pub, a thug and his beautiful daughter. Cast also includes William Gillespie, Estelle Harrison, George Rowe.
results.description: A fast paced slapstick farce starring Gaylord Lloyd (Harold Lloyd’s brother). Set in England, involves a debt collector, scores of bobbys, a pub, a thug and his beautiful daughter. Cast also includes William Gillespie, Estelle Harrison, George Rowe.

results.title: Dodge City
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures and Michael Curtiz
results.brief_description: Michael Curtiz (Mildred Pierce, Casablanca, Angels with dirty faces) directed this star vehicle for Errol Flynn with whom he collaborated the year before on “The Adventures of Robin Hood”. In “Dodge City” Flynn plays Wade Hatton, a successful and scrupulous man who, with a loyal crew in tow, herds buffalo across Texas to various destinations. On one such trip the crew are also protecting settler families headed for Dodge City. The frontier life is depicted as dangerous and corrupt, especially in towns thriving on alcohol, gambling and prostitution. As a town with no sheriff, Dodge City is such a town - violent, lawless and ruled by the local saloon owner who murders any individual that tries to collect on honest debts. As a principled and fearless man, Hatton is implored to be sheriff and clean up Dodge City. Flynn is well cast as Hatton, a charming and handsome cowboy. Oliva de Havilland (who starred as Maid Marion in The Adventures of Robin Hood) plays his love interest Abbie Irving, a schoolteacher and journalist. As a Western intended for the Saturday matinee “Dodge City” is replete with scenes of cattle stampedes, bar room brawls and runaway trains. “Dodge City” features some glorious exterior scenes and was filmed in Technicolour.

On one such trip the crew are also protecting settler families headed for Dodge City. The frontier life is depicted as dangerous and corrupt, especially in towns thriving on alcohol, gambling and prostitution. As a town with no sheriff, Dodge City is such a town - violent, lawless and ruled by the local saloon owner who murders any individual that tries to collect on honest debts. As a principled and fearless man, Hatton is implored to be sheriff and clean up Dodge City. Flynn is well cast as Hatton, a charming and handsome cowboy. Oliva de Havilland (who starred as Maid Marion in The Adventures of Robin Hood) plays his love interest Abbie Irving, a schoolteacher and journalist. As a Western intended for the Saturday matinee “Dodge City” is replete with scenes of cattle stampedes, bar room brawls and runaway trains. “Dodge City” features some glorious exterior scenes and was filmed in Technicolour.

results.title: Documenting Addicus
results.brief_description: An interactive work featuring the day-today experiences of Addicus, an eccentric and lonely young man, reflected both in moving image and in text through his diary.

results.title: Documentary: 1948 - 1976
results.creator_credit: Texture Films, Herman J. Engel and Sonya Freidman
results.brief_description: Part three of a three part compilation history of the documentary film. This part presents films from 1948-1976. Each sequence offers an important example of documentary film style, content and construction. Before eac of the documentaries presented, there is an introduction that place the film historically.
